text.p: Here are highlights from Polish newspapers this morning.
RZECZPOSPOLITA
- The listed Exbud construction firm has offered 850,000 zlotys for a controlling stake in the Centrum Targowe Kielce (CTK) trading centre.
The regional development agency (ARR) will also bid for the company currently controlled by the Kielce municipality .
- Belgium's Lhoist capital group has acquired a 67-percent stake in the Bukowa Gora-based ZPW lime producing plant.
Lhoist guaranteed to invest 38 million marks in development and retain the present employment level in the next three years, the contract said.
- The Warsaw-based Ursus truck maker made 15,181 trucks in the first eleven months of this year, showing a slight decline compared with last year's results, the company said.
NOWA EUROPA
- In the first half of 1996, 31,000 cars were were stolen in Poland, an eight-percent decline compared with the same period last year.
- Poland's finance ministry has signed an agreement with HSBC Investment Services to advise in the privatisation of the Powszechny Bank Kredytowy (PBK) bank.
- The government-regulated price of one square metre of residential space in the third quarter of 1996 was 1,170 zlotys, the finance and construction ministries said.
The price is used to calculate guarantee premiums on housing development savings.
- The Gdansk refinery has contracted hydrocracking equipment construction worth $80 million from Italy's Snamprogetti, controlled by ENI.
The new equipment will allow an increase in output and enhance product quality, the refinery said.
GAZETA WYBORCZA
- A new bridge on the Polish-German border was opened in Olszyna yesterday.
The 193-metre-long bridge can bear 50-tonne trucks and cost 80 million zlotys to build.

- The Chemix company, located in Debnica Kaszubska, northern Poland, has started assemblying Belorussian MAZ trucks equipped with German MAN engines, foreign trade ministry spokesman Zbigniew Ostrowski said.
- Fiat's Siena sedan model will be produced in Poland-based Fiat plants, Fiat Auto President Robert Testore said.

- Poland's food exports to former Soviet states accounted for 45.3 percent of total food exports and were worth $556 million, while sales to EU countries accounted for 43 percent of the total, the Agricultural Assistance Programmes' Foundation monitoring unit said.
ZYCIE

- Gdansk's Rebiechowo airport will construct a new domestic and international terminal for 20 million zlotys and a new air traffic control tower which will cost five million zlotys to build, the airport's investment director Wlodzimierz Machczynski said.

- National Investment Funds' (NFI) share issue prospectuses will be signed by the state secretary responsible for privatisation Wielaw Kaczmarek and passed to the Polish Securities Commission (KPW) by the weekend.

- The financial condition of the listed Ocean Company, PLI SA and Krakchemia SA has improved recently with the companies growing sales and net profits, a report by the Bank Handlowy Capital Operations Centre (BH COK) said.
PARKIET
- NetWest securities analysts recommend investors to increase stakes in Polish companies in their European emerging markets portfolios.
- Bank Ochrony Srodowiska (BOS) brokerage house is the first in Poland to offer services via Internet.
